3 Terms, definitions and abbreviations
3.1 Terms defined in ISO 10303-1
For the purposes of this document, the following terms defined in ISO 10303-1 apply:
application;
application protocol;
data;
information;
integrated resource;
product.
3.2 Other terms and definitions For the purposes of this document, the following terms and definitions apply:
3.2.1
application interpreted construct (AIC)
logical grouping of interpreted constructs that supports a specific function for the usage of product data across multiple application contexts
3.2.2
application module reusable collection of a scope statement, information requirements, mappings and module interpreted model that supports a specific usage of product data across multiple application contexts
3.2.3
common resources collection of information models, specified in EXPRESS language, that can be reused to specify application specific information models within the domain of industrial data
NOTE 1 Adapted from ISO TC184/SC4/N1375 [3]
NOTE 2 The resource constructs defined by application modules are those defined in their MIM schema.
3.2.4
module interpreted model information model that uses the common resources necessary to satisfy the information requirements and constraints of an application reference model, within an application module
3.3 Abbreviations
For the purposes of this document, the following abbreviations apply:
AM application module
ARM application reference model
MIM module interpreted model
URL uniform resource locator
